com.meteorcode.pathway.model

Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.meteorcode.pathway.model.Event
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AsciiViewEvent, BaseEvent, BounceEvent, Move, MoveEvent

    public abstract class Event
extends java.lang.Object
    An Event in the event loop. Do note that Events are immutable. If you want to modify an Event that's on the stack, swallow that Event and fire a new Event with the appropriate data changed. Don't forget to invalidate old events on the stack.

      • Event

        public Event(java.lang.String name,
     Context origin)
        Constructor for an Event without a data payload. This creates a new Event with the payload set to empty map. Use this only when you need an Event which carries no additional data beyond its' name, as you cannot add data to the payload of empty events after initialization.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this Event.
        origin - The Context where this event originated.

    • Method Detail

      • evalEvent

        public abstract void evalEvent()
                        throws ScriptException

        The method that is called to actually perform the thing done by an Event. Should be called as part of the event loop, when an event is finally... you know, evented.

        NOTE that this occurs after the event has been propagated, and also NOTE that this method will *not* be called on an invalidated Event. (Event code shouldn't have to worry whether or not they're invalid)

        Throws:
        ScriptException

        public java.lang.String getName()

        public boolean isValid()

        Returns:

      • fireEventChild

        public boolean fireEventChild(Event e)

        Cause an Event to be fired - in the current context - as a child/result of another Event. If successful, the Event passed to this method inherits this Event as its parent, and is fired into this Event's Context for evaluation. Method returns true IFF this process was successful. The default implementation does this.

        In the event that firing Children from this Event is unsuccessful or disallowed, the method should return false instead, and should not modify the Event parameter, e.

        Parameters:
        e - The Event to fire
        Returns:
        child The new child Event.

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget(Context c)
        Set the Context of this Event to the specified Context.
        Parameters:
        c - the new Context to set

      • getParent

        public Event getParent()
        Returns:
        a pointer to the parent Event
